Author: calioseee
Content:
Seeing how Euro is on the rise rn and rupiah is basically dying, i would like to help y'all if y'all want to get some info on how to move to germany. Basically giving y'all the starter pack of studying or working in germany. This post is directed towards highschoolers or undergraduates. lmk ur questions and I'll answer them when I have time

I'm currently doing my bachelors in germany, I'll gladly share my experience and tips

Author: liz2liz
Content: maybe starter pack nya apa aja dulu

Author: calioseee
Content: honestly ini bakal beda2 dan bakal tergantung dari jalan yg mau dipilih (kuliah/Ausbildung/FSJ/others)

Author: calioseee
Content:
but for me personally i would say what yall need to have before applying for stuff in germany tuh ini:

1. Language certificate (min B1, recommended B2)
2. Money **for students(uni)!** *more details soon
3. Rapot kelas 11-12 diterjemahkan oleh penerjemah yang tersumpah (in german)
4. Health insurance for visa application (might be given from the company if ure about to do Ausbildung)
5. List of uni/companies to apply to

Author: calioseee
Content:
as a Student here, u could work as a "Working Student" which is basically a PAID internship programm where you could learn and collect some experience before going into the real working environment. As a working student you won't have as big of a responsibility as a full time and you'll only mostly "learn" how the company works. With this working contract, you'll be able to work 20hrs/Week and earn around 12-15â‚¬/hr. 

Unfortunately Polsci doesn't really offer as many job offers as Econs. But you'll find offer everywhere before the beginning of every winter and summer semesters. So you'll just have to actively look for offers.

Author: calioseee
Content: rata2 10-20jt buat les + ujian bahasa jerman sampe B1, dan tinggal cari tawaran Ausbildung sendiri tanpa agent jadi bisa hemat biaya.
